title: Napoli Have Just One Fully Fit Forward Ahead Of Important Serie A Showdown With Inter Milan
description: Inter vs Napoli is shaping up to be a stark contrast in attacking options, with Antonio Conte facing major limitations and Rasmus Hojlund the only fully fit forward available.According to Corriere del...
fullText:
Inter vs Napoli is shaping up to be a stark contrast in attacking options, with Antonio Conte facing major limitations and Rasmus Hojlund the only fully fit forward available.

According to Corriere dello Sport, the entire build-up to the Scudetto showdown can be summed up by Napoli‚Äôs offensive situation.

Conte is preparing the match ‚Äúwith only Hojlund at peak physical and mental condition in attack. A unique specimen,‚Äù the paper notes.

Among the already known absentees, even David Neres remains a serious doubt.

Despite being considered the true attacking partner for the Danish striker.

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì DECEMBER 06: Cristian Chivu, Head Coach of FC Internazionale Milano, looks on prior to the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and Como 1907 at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on December 06, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

The picture is very different on the Inter side.

Cristian Chivu is dealing with what the newspaper calls ‚Äúthe comfortable embarrassment of abundance.‚Äù

In a 3-5-2, he can choose from Lautaro Martinez, Marcus Thuram, Pio Esposito and Bonny.

Indeed, even a wrong initial choice would come with proven in-game solutions.

However, with goals conceded level at 15, the real difference lies in production.

Inter have scored 40 goals to Napoli‚Äôs 28.

Napoli have shown resilience, but arrive at San Siro with limited solutions.

title: Storm Center: January 10, 2026 ‚Äî the National Championship Game matchup is set
description: Miami vs Indiana for the CFP National Championship
fullText:
Here we go to start your Saturday:

Miami won their CFP Semifinal 2 nights ago, and Indiana won theirs last night.

The Hoosiers demolished Oregon 56-22 in a game that was never close. Indiana got a pick-6 on the first snap of the game, and cruised from there. They scored 28 points off of turnovers (1 pick-6, 2 fumbles, 1 blocked punt) and physically dominated Oregon at every available opportunity.

With the win, Indiana moves to 15-0 and looks to secure their first National Championship next Monday night. We hope they don‚Äôt, obviously, as Miami is the opponent.

The National Championship Game is set.

#10 Miami Hurricanes (13-2) vs #1 Indiana Hoosiers (15-0)

THE CFP NATIONAL CHAMPIONSHIP IS SETüèÜ#CFBPlayoff x #NationalChampionship pic.twitter.com/VBOywn2FmO

‚Äî College Football Playoff (@CFBPlayoff) January 10, 2026

Miami has been favorites in 12 of their 15 games this season. The only times they weren‚Äôt: the opener against Notre Dame, the CFP first round against Texas A&M, and the CFP Quarterfinals against Ohio State. Miami were favorites against Ole Miss, since I know some people think I missed that one. I did not.

After beating Ole Miss, Miami is an underdog in the National Championship Game. The early line had Miami as a 5.5pt underdog against Indiana. After Indiana‚Äôs demolition of Oregon in the 1st half last night, that number went up slightly. The actual opening line:

Per @FDSportsbook, Miami opens as 7.5pt underdogs against Indiana in the College Football Playoff National Championship Game

Over/Under 47.5

‚Äî StateOfTheU.com (@TheStateOfTheU) January 10, 2026

This line is fine. Indiana is a strong team with an undefeated record, and they deserve to be favored. Regardless of the line, Miami will be prepared and give everything to win a National Championship.

‚ÄúCool story, Cam‚Äù. I know, I know. Just sharing the number, well the hypothetical numbers in this case, same as I have every week this season. Do with that information as you will.

PFF‚Äôs review of the Miami-Ole Miss Fiesta Bowl

Dennis Dodd of CBS Sports tweeted this Ode to Miami (long tweet)

We will talk about this for the rest of our lives. #CanesDrive pic.twitter.com/fRZ4WeHxDn

‚Äî Jason (@Canes_Chief) January 9, 2026

Tom Fornelli of The Cover 3 Podcast and CBS Sports wrote that SEC no longer deserves the benefit of the doubt

Brandon Marcello of CBS Sports wrote about Carson Beck‚Äôs vindication, and Miami on the doorstep of a Championship

Top 2027 recruit WR Nick Lennear (Miami Northwestern) REALLY enjoyed Miami‚Äôs win while at an All-American game.

Nick Lennear born to be a cane.

Go ahead and make that official. pic.twitter.com/VwidSB62ZB

‚Äî Top Tier Miami (@TopTierCanes) January 9, 2026

The National Championship Game is set.

Miami Hurricanes. Indiana Hoosiers. For all the marbles.

title: Hansi Flick talks Lamine Yamal, Kylian Mbapp√©, and Eric Garcia vs Frenkie de Jong ahead of Spanish Super Cup final against Real Madrid
description: The Bar√ßa coach spoke to the press on Saturday
fullText:
Barcelona manager Hansi Flick spoke to the press in Saudi Arabia ahead of Sunday‚Äôs Spanish Super Cup Final against Real Madrid, as Bar√ßa look for their first El Cl√°sico win of the season to defend their Supercopa crown against their eternal rivals.

Flick spoke about Kylian Mbapp√©, who is expected to play after recovering from a minor knee injury, confirmed that Lamine Yamal is ready to start on Sunday after playing only 20 minutes in the semi-final against Athletic Club due to illness, and also talked about the decision of starting either Eric Garcia or Frenkie de Jong in midfield against Los Blancos.

Here‚Äôs a summary of the best quotes from Hansi‚Äôs presser:

Kylian Mbapp√©
‚ÄúCurrently, Mbapp√© is the best striker. He has scored a lot of goals and has world-class talent. We watched the semi-finals together, the whole team.

‚ÄúHow many Cl√°sicos have we played in the last year and a half? And how many have we lost? We‚Äôve lost one. That‚Äôs what it‚Äôs about. I know Mbapp√© is a fantastic player and that he‚Äôs phenomenal when he has space behind the defense. We‚Äôll adapt some things, as we always do. But not specifically because of Mbapp√©. We‚Äôre focused on our philosophy, on our ideas.‚Äù

Lamine Yamal
‚ÄúYes [he can start], all the players are ready to be on the team. It‚Äôs great to have everyone together. Especially Gavi and Christensen.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll decide [the starting XI] after the last training session. The important thing is that we have options in every position, and they‚Äôre all good. Everyone wants to play and be a starter. The key is the team. We have to make the right decision.‚Äù

Eric or Frenkie in midfield
‚ÄúI was very pleased with Wednesday‚Äôs performance. But we also have other options. Frenkie and Eric can play. Gerard is having a fantastic season. Today we have our final training session; we‚Äôll see what we need. Everyone is available. We‚Äôll decide then.‚Äù

title: Chargers vs. New England Patriots: How to watch, start time, odds and prediction
description: Everything you need to know about the Chargers facing the New England Patriots in the AFC wild-card playoffs, including how to watch and a score prediction.
fullText:
Both quarterbacks have had outstanding seasons and will meet on a huge stage Sunday night, each looking to pick up his first victory in the NFL playoffs.

Whereas Herbert is 0-2 in Chargers postseason games, Maye is making his first postseason appearance for the New England Patriots after assembling a most valuable player-caliber season.

Herbert hasn‚Äôt gotten as much MVP mention but has been elite, especially considering the state of his injury-riddled offensive line, which has a new configuration virtually every week.

Jim Harbaugh and the Patriots‚Äô Mike Vrabel are two of the league‚Äôs most talented coaches too, and this figures to be a balanced matchup.

The Patriots won 14 games ‚Äî a whopping 10 more than the year before ‚Äî but didn‚Äôt play a lot of great quarterbacks, a middler‚Äôs row that included Cam Ward, Spencer Rattler, Dillon Gabriel and a 40-year-old Joe Flacco.

Twice the Chargers have lost playoff games at New England, falling short in the AFC championship game to end the 2007 season and a divisional game in 2018.

How the Chargers can win: The Chargers need to put the Patriots on their heels by slowing the running game, which has been New England‚Äôs key to winning lately, and force the pass. Maye's receivers don‚Äôt have a lot of big-play potential. On defense the Patriots are solid but not overwhelming. The Chargers need to be effective on third down ‚Äî need to stay in third-and-manageable ‚Äî to keep drives alive and keep that Patriots defense on the field. Of course protecting Herbert is a priority and it‚Äôs a challenge with an offensive line that‚Äôs constantly being reshuffled. If the Chargers score early and often, they can take the crowd out of the game.

How the Patriots can win: New England has to stay out of obvious passing situations against an opportunistic Chargers defense. That means leaning on the running game, something the Patriots have done the last month. The Patriots need to shore up the defense against the run, although the Chargers don‚Äôt thrive on that with a banged-up Omarion Hampton and backups. If the Patriots can avoid the turnovers and establish a methodical tempo, they can inch away with field goals.

Chargers: WR KeAndre Lambert-Smith (hamstring, out); S Kendall Williamson (ankle, out); RB Omarion Hampton (ankle, questionable); OLB Bud Dupree (hamstring, questionable); DB Elijah Molden (hamstring, questionable); OT Austin Deculus (oblique, questionable); LB Del‚ÄôShawn Phillips (hamstring, questionable), TE Tucker Fisk (ankle, questionable).

Patriots: DT Khyiris Tonga (foot, out); OT Thayer Munford Jr. (knee, questionable); WR Kayshon Boutte (hamstring, questionable); LB Harold Landry III (knee, questionable); CB Alex Austin (wrist, questionable).

The Chargers and Patriots play Sunday at 5:15 p.m. PST at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Mass. The game will be shown on NBC, Peacock and Universo (Espa√±ol). In Southern California fans can listen to the game on 640 AM and 105.5 FM (Espa√±ol).

Sam Farmer‚Äôs pick: The Patriots haven‚Äôt faced many elite quarterbacks ‚Äî they went 1-1 against the Josh Allen-led Buffalo Bills ‚Äî so Herbert will be a challenge. Still, if they can get to him behind that battered offensive line, it will be hard for the Chargers to consistently move the ball. The cold weather shouldn‚Äôt be a huge factor unless the wind starts whipping. Maye has been outstanding.

Get the best, most interesting and strangest stories of the day from the L.A. sports scene and beyond from our newsletter The Sports Report.

This story originally appeared in Los Angeles Times.

title: Battle Of The Centre-Forwards As Argentina Sensation Welcomes Danish Counterpart To San Siro For Inter Milan & Napoli Clash
description: Inter vs Napoli will also be defined by the duel between Lautaro Martinez and Rasmus Hojlund, with the two centre-forwards set to lead the line at San Siro.According to La Repubblica, the matchup carr...
fullText:
Inter vs Napoli will also be defined by the duel between Lautaro Martinez and Rasmus Hojlund, with the two centre-forwards set to lead the line at San Siro.

According to La Repubblica, the matchup carries extra edge for Lautaro, whose last encounter with Napoli ended badly.

That night brought defeat for Inter and heated exchanges on the pitch, including friction with his former coach Antonio Conte.

This time, the Argentine arrives in a very different frame of mind and form.

Lautaro is already on 10 league goals this season and currently tops the Serie A scoring charts.

His consistency has once again made him the reference point of Inter‚Äôs attack and one of the most decisive players in the division.

NAPLES, ITALY ‚Äì OCTOBER 01: Rasmus Hojlund of SSC Napoli celebrates after scoring his side first goal during the UEFA Champions League 2025/26 League Phase MD2 match between SSC Napoli and Sporting Clube de Portugal at Stadio Diego Armando Maradona on October 01, 2025 in Naples, Italy. (Photo by Francesco Pecoraro/Getty Images)

The newspaper highlights how the Inter captain came away from Parma midweek almost surprised not to have scored, having found the net in each of his previous five matches.

It underlines numbers that are now routine rather than exceptional.

Since arriving in Milan in 2018, brought in by Diego Milito and Javier Zanetti from Racing Club, Lautaro has scored 167 goals for Inter.

He now sits just five goals behind Roberto Boninsegna on the club‚Äôs all-time scorers list, with another historic milestone firmly within reach.

Hojlund represents Napoli‚Äôs main threat at the other end, but the contrast in attacking depth is clear.

For Inter, the battle of the number nines could once again tilt the balance on a night that may prove decisive in the title race.

title: NFL Wild Card Weekend Longshot Bets: Underdogs, Props & High-Payout Plays
description: Looking for value this postseason? We break down the best NFL Wild Card Weekend longshot bets, including underdogs, prop plays, and high-payout angles.
fullText:
Super Wild Card Weekend in the NFL is built for chaos ‚Äî and chaos creates opportunity for bettors willing to chase longshot value.

Our experts have identified four longshot NFL picks with the potential to boost your ROI as three straight days of knockout football take center stage.

Trevor Lawrence 3+ passing TDs (+350 at FanDuel)

Tommy Tremble anytime TD (+650 at FanDuel)

Dalton Schultz first TD (+850 at FanDuel)

Each team to score 1+ rushing touchdown (+12500 at FanDuel)

Trevor Lawrence 3+ passing touchdowns (+350)

Trevor Lawrence has thrown three or more scores in three of his last four games. He‚Äôs also piled up 10 passing TDs over his last three home starts, with this pass-catching group playing its best football of the season.

Parker Washington has 347 yards over the last three games, Jakobi Meyers continues to move the chains, and Brian Thomas remains a matchup problem. Add in Brenton Strange and Travis Etienne as a receiving threat, and there are plenty of ways for this offense to score.

The Buffalo Bills are banged up in the secondary, with rookie Maxwell Hairston out and Jordan Poyer questionable, plus linebacker Terrel Bernard missing practice. If the Bills sell out to stop the run, Lawrence should be forced to throw ‚Äî and that sets up well for another strong passing day.

Tommy Tremble anytime TD (+650)

This is a massive price for a clear-cut TE1 on a team that should be throwing more than usual as a double-digit home underdog.

In his first game without Ja‚ÄôTavion Sanders, Tremble stepped into the TE1 role and caught three of four targets for 38 yards and a TD at +500. Tommy Tremble ranked third in route share and logged a 90% snap rate, second among pass catchers.

He‚Äôs clearly involved yet priced like a TE2 with minimal usage. With Sanders still on IR, this should be closer to +300 or +330.

After missing Week 18, Nico Collins returns to the Texans' lineup on Monday. But even with their star wideout back, we still need to consider tight end Dalton Schultz a live option to score the opener against the Steelers.

He‚Äôs only scored three times all season, but two of those have come in the past month. He ranks second on the Texans roster in red-zone targets across the year.

With the Steelers giving up 11 touchdowns to TEs this season, tied for third-most in the league, it could be a good Monday for the former Stanford man.

Each team to score 1+ rushing TD (+12500)

You can‚Äôt write a longshot article without one true lotto ticket, and Wild Card Weekend sets up perfectly for a swing like this.

Across the six-game slate, we‚Äôre looking at a mix of run-heavy offenses, potential weather spots, and elite ground games capable of dictating terms through both scheme and talent.

This bet leans on proven touchdown producers like Kyren Williams (10), Rico Dowdle (6), Josh Jacobs (13), D‚ÄôAndre Swift (9), James Cook (12), Josh Allen (14), Travis Etienne (7), Trevor Lawrence (9), Christian McCaffrey (10), Saquon Barkley (7), Jalen Hurts (8), and TreVeyon Henderson (9).

It‚Äôs a sprinkle-only play ‚Äî but if Wild Card chaos hits the right way, this is the kind of ticket that can cap the weekend with a massive ROI.

Make your NFL bets at FanDuel, America's No. 1 sportsbook! 

Chargers vs Patriots predictions

title: Game Preview: Calgary Flames @ Pittsburgh Penguins 1/10/26
description: Who: Calgary Flames (18-22-4, 40 points, 7th place Pacific Division) @ Pittsburgh Penguins (21-12-9, 51 points, 4th place Metropolitan Division) When: 3:30 p.m. eastern How to Watch: Broadcast locally Sportsnet Pittsburgh and SN/TVAS, streaming on ESPN+ Pens‚Äô Path Ahead: The busy stretch continues tomorrow with a 5 p.m. ET game in Boston.
fullText:
Who:¬†Calgary Flames¬†(18-22-4, 40 points, 7th place Pacific Division) @¬†Pittsburgh Penguins¬†(21-12-9, 51 points, 4th place Metropolitan Division)

How to Watch: Broadcast locally Sportsnet Pittsburgh and SN/TVAS, streaming on ESPN+

Pens‚Äô Path Ahead: The busy stretch continues tomorrow with a 5 p.m. ET game in Boston. Then it‚Äôs back to Pittsburgh for three home games next week, starting with the Tampa Bay Lightning on Tuesday and followed by division matchups against the Philadelphia Flyers and Columbus Blue Jackets on Thursday and Saturday, respectively.

Opponent Track: It‚Äôs been a dispiriting stretch in Calgary. The Flames are on a four-game losing skid, and they‚Äôve been held to just one goal in each of their last three games (while getting outscored by a total of 18-3). Calgary most recently dropped a back-to-back set in Montreal and Boston earlier this week.

Season Series: This is the first time the Flames and Pens have met this season. They‚Äôll see one another later this month, when the Pens head to Calgary on Jan. 21 as part of a four-game West Coast road swing.

Hidden Stat:¬†The Flames are heading into this matchup with the worst road points percentage in the NHL, going 6-15-2 (.304 points percentage) in 23 away games so far this season.

Hidden Stat II: Courtesy of Pens PR, the Penguins are 13-1-4 in games where at least one member of the current fourth line (Connor Dewar, Blake Lizotte and Noel Acciari) records a point.

Jonathan Huberdeau ‚Äì Nazem Kadri ‚Äì Joel Farabee

Blake Coleman ‚Äì Mikael Backlund ‚Äì Matt Coronato

Connor Zary ‚Äì Morgan Frost ‚Äì Yegor Sharangovich

Ryan Lomberg ‚Äì Justin Kirkland ‚Äì Adam Klapka

Yan Kuznetsov / MacKenzie Weegar

Joel Hanley / Hunter Brzustewicz

Goalies:¬†Dustin Wolf, Devin Cooley

Potential scratches: Zayne Parekh (day-to-day upper body injury), William Stromgren, Brayden Pachal

Injured Reserve: Jake Bean, Samuel Honk, John Beecher, Martin Pospisil

Flames fans haven‚Äôt gotten to see rookie defenseman Zayne Parekh since he set a record for Canadian World Juniors defensemen with 13 points in seven games of the 2025 tournament. The 19-year-old was sidelined for Calgary‚Äôs back-to-back earlier this week.

Dustin Wolf has made eight straight starts for the Flames, including in the team‚Äôs losses to the Habs and Bruins on consecutive days last week. Backup Devin Cooley has been dealing with an illness, according to head coach Ryan Huska, who admitted it has not been ‚Äúideal‚Äù to be playing Wolf this much. Whether Wolf (3-5-0 over this stretch) gets a ninth straight start against the Pens could depend on Cooley‚Äôs health status.

The Flames are about to hit a crossroads at the trade deadline. Right now, they‚Äôre in no man‚Äôs land. They‚Äôre ostensibly still in the playoff race (six points back of a Western Conference Wild Card spot with 38 games left in the season). They had a resurgent December (9-4-0) before their January slump (0-4).

They‚Äôre playing veterans and keeping young players on a tight leash‚Äî rookie winger William Stromgren made his NHL debut on Wednesday, but skated just over eight minutes before getting scratched for Thursday‚Äôs matchup with the Bruins.

The Flames are also the lowest-scoring team in the NHL with 2.13 goals for per game, and they‚Äôre allowing the fifth-most goals against (3.57 per game). The Calgary power play is ticking along at just 12.5 percent.

Blake Coleman has been tied to the Montreal Canadiens by TSN‚Äôs Pierre LeBrun. Rasmus Andersson is an obvious trade chip given that he‚Äôs playing on an expiring contract. Whether these players and others ultimately get moved at the deadline could depend at least in part on how soon the Flames can end their ongoing losing streak.

Infographic courtesy of Pens PR

Rickard Rakell ‚Äì Sidney Crosby ‚Äì Bryan Rust

Evgeni Malkin ‚Äì Ben Kindel ‚Äì Yegor Chinakhov

Anthony Mantha ‚Äì Tommy Novak ‚Äì Justin Brazeau

Connor Dewar ‚Äì Blake Lizotte ‚Äì Noel Acciari

Parker Wotherspoon / Erik Karlsson

Goalies:¬†Stuart Skinner and Arturs Silovs

Potential Scratches:¬†Ville Koivunen, Kevin Hayes, Connor Clifton

IR:¬†Filip Hallander, Caleb Jones, Rutger McGroarty

The Penguins had an optional practice Friday ahead of today‚Äôs afternoon game and this weekend‚Äôs back-to-back set, per Michelle Crechiolo.

Muse called this a "get what you need" day. 

"We had things set up for everybody‚Ä¶ for guys that felt like they needed to get on the ice, with the afternoon game tomorrow, they had that option. For other guys, it's getting in the gym, getting activation, getting treatments." https://t.co/DnIAfwy7QC

‚Äî Pens Inside Scoop (@PensInsideScoop) January 9, 2026

Malkin made his return from injury on Ben Kindel‚Äôs wing during Thursday‚Äôs win over the Devils. We‚Äôll see if he sticks on the wing or returns to his natural center position for his second game back.

Only the Tampa Bay Lightning (eight straight wins) are currently riding a longer victory streak than the Pens (six consecutive victories).

Since the NHL's holiday break concluded, the Penguins lead the league in wins (6), points (12), goals per game (4.83), goals against (13) and goal differential (+16). pic.twitter.com/N4ROFPqsri

‚Äî Penguins PR (@PenguinsPR) January 9, 2026

title: Steelers $10 million defender named top cut candidate
description: The Steelers‚Äô linebacker could be released
fullText:
The Pittsburgh Steelers signed linebacker Malik Harrison last offseason to a two-year, $10 million deal, which was a signing that came with some annoyance from the fan base. It wasn‚Äôt so much a jab at Harrison, but he was signed while the Steelers let Elandon Roberts leave in free agency.

While the Steelers have a wild card game to look forward to on Monday, Over The Cap released its list of 100 cut candidates, and Harrison made the list for Pittsburgh. None of his 2026 salary is guaranteed, and the Steelers could look elsewhere for more productive depth at the position. He finished the regular season with 28 tackles.

The Steelers will look to end their playoff-win drought on Monday night. Should they lose to Houston, that streak reaches nine seasons without a playoff win.

title: WVU hosts No. 22 Kansas in sold-out Big 12 matchup in Morgantown
description: West Virginia hosts No. 22 Kansas for a sold-out noon tip as both teams look to gain early traction in Big 12 play. Here‚Äôs everything you need to know about the matchup and how to watch.
fullText:
Date: Saturday, January 10, 2026

Location: Hope Coliseum ‚Äî Morgantown, West Virginia

Announcers: Brandon Gaudin and LaPhonso Ellis

Streaming: FOX Sports (TV provider login required)

Radio:¬†Mountaineer Sports Network (Radio Affiliates) | SiriusXM Channel 380 and Streaming Channel 970 | WVU Gameday App (Apple¬†|¬†Android)

Radio Announcers: Tony Caridi (PBP) and Brad Howe (analyst)

Reminder:¬†It is¬†against site policy to post links to illegal streams¬†in the comments.

Get in on the action with our friends at FanDuel Sportsbook.

West Virginia: +3.5 points | +158 ML

(As of 12:30AM ET/January 10, 2026)

West Virginia is back at home this afternoon, hosting Kansas after picking up a 62‚Äì60 win over Cincinnati earlier this week. The Mountaineers (10‚Äì5, 1‚Äì1) had to mount a late comeback to get through that one, but they pulled it off and avoided an 0‚Äì2 start to Big 12 play.

Honor Huff carried the offense against the Bearcats with 24 points, knocking down six threes, while Treysen Eaglestaff provided what would be the game winner with a late three that put WVU back in front for good. Chance Moore added 14 off the bench, continuing to give the Mountaineers a reliable presence when the offense needed a jolt. WVU shot well from the perimeter, though rebounding and second chances again became an issue during extended stretches.

Kansas comes to Morgantown at 11‚Äì4 overall and 1‚Äì1 in Big 12 play. The Jayhawks dropped their opener at UCF before rallying from a 16-point deficit to beat TCU, 104-101, in overtime earlier this week. Overall, they‚Äôre averaging 77.7 points per game while shooting 47 percent from the floor.

Freshman guard Darryn Peterson has been the star of the show. After returning from a hamstring injury, Peterson scored 26 and 32 points in his last two games and is averaging 22.5 points in limited action. Ross Hodge noted this week that Peterson doesn‚Äôt need much help to create offense, which puts pressure on the entire defensive group to stay disciplined over long stretches.

Kansas isn‚Äôt short on help around him. Tre White, Flory Bidunga, and Melvin Council Jr. all average double figures and give the Jayhawks multiple options when possessions break down. Kansas has been most comfortable when games open up, particularly when they‚Äôre able to score before defenses are set.

New, improved notifications system!

Comment on articles, community posts

Saturday‚Äôs game will be the 30th meeting between West Virginia and Kansas since the Mountaineers joined the Big 12 in 2013. The series has produced a number of close finishes and notable moments, particularly in Morgantown, where WVU holds a 7‚Äì5 record against the Jayhawks.

West Virginia has won two straight in the series, including last season‚Äôs 62‚Äì61 victory at Allen Fieldhouse and a 91‚Äì85 win in Morgantown two years ago. Other home highlights include a 91‚Äì79 win in 2021 and buzzer-beaters in 2015 and 2019. WVU‚Äôs largest margin of victory came in 2017, a 16-point win during the ‚ÄúPress Virginia‚Äù era against a Kansas team ranked No. 2 nationally.

Kansas has more ways to score, especially if Darryn Peterson is comfortable early. West Virginia has generally played well defensively at home, but they‚Äôve also had stretches where the offense slows and extra possessions creep in.

If WVU can avoid long dry spells, this should stay tight into the second half. Kansas‚Äô depth shows up late more often than not, and that‚Äôs usually enough to create some separation.

title: Baggio: Three Italy World Cup eliminations ‚Äònot easy to digest‚Äô
description: Italy legend Roberto Baggio still carries a ‚Äòweight‚Äô for missing a decisive penalty kick against Brazil in the 1994 World Cup Final: ‚ÄòI lost three World Cups on penalties, not easy to digest.‚Äô...
fullText:
Italy legend Roberto Baggio still carries a ‚Äòweight‚Äô for missing a decisive penalty kick against Brazil in the 1994 World Cup Final: ‚ÄòI lost three World Cups on penalties, not easy to digest.‚Äô

Italy legend Baggio said his penalty kick miss in the 1994 World Cup Final was ‚Äúthe greatest bitterness of my football career.‚Äù

‚ÄúI grew up with the dream of a World Cup Final against Brazil. I don‚Äôt have a clear memory of why this goal has stayed with me since I was very young, through my entire life,‚Äù Baggio told Forbes Italia via Gazzetta.

‚ÄúI have always considered myself an ordinary person. Just like everyone else. I never saw myself as special. I only had this uncontrollable passion for football. A passion that stirs something inside you from morning to night. I slept with the ball.

Italian former football player Roberto Baggio (R) and Argentine-born Italian former football player, David Trezeguet (L) gesture before the beginning of the Argentina 2023 U-20 World Cup final match between Uruguay and Italy at the Estadio Unico Diego Armando Maradona stadium in La Plata, Argentina, on June 11, 2023. (Photo by Alejandro PAGNI / AFP) (Photo by ALEJANDRO PAGNI/AFP via Getty Images)

‚ÄúI would have given up everything else to win that World Cup. I was representing Italy. It was the goal I was always chasing. The last thought before going to sleep was how to win that World Cup. Maybe by scoring a bicycle kick.

‚ÄúThen it turned out in a way I never would have imagined, and I will never be able to forget it. Just one step away from the finish line. The greatest bitterness of my football career, an unbelievable personal tragedy, I still carry that weight inside me.‚Äù

FLORENCE, ITALY ‚Äì JUNE 03: Roberto Baggio looks on during a press conference at Centro Tecnico Federale di Coverciano on June 03, 2024 in Florence, Italy. (Photo by Claudio Villa/Getty Images)

Baggio took part in three World Cups. The Azzurri finished third in 1990, runners-up in 1994 and were eliminated in the quarter-finals by eventual winners France in 1998.

‚ÄúI played in three World Cups. In Italy [1990], we finished third, winning six matches and drawing one. I lost three World Cups on penalties, not easy to digest,‚Äù he concluded.

title: Inter eye move for Bassey but Fulham make January transfer decision ‚Äì report

fullText:
Reports in the UK suggest that Inter are among the Serie A clubs interested in versatile Fulham defender Calvin Bassey, but the Premier League side don‚Äôt want to sell the Nigerian this month.

TeamTalk reports that Inter are among the Serie A clubs interested in Fulham defender Bassey.

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì SEPTEMBER 30: FC Internazionale team line up during the UEFA Champions League 2025/26 League Phase MD2 match between FC Internazionale Milano and SK Slavia Praha at Stadio San Siro on September 30, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

The Nerazzurri are expected to make big changes in central defence over the coming months, given that Francesco Acerbi and Stefan de Vrij are expected to leave at the end of their contracts in June.

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì DECEMBER 09: Francesco Acerbi of FC Internazionale lies injured during the UEFA Champions League 2025/26 League Phase MD6 match between FC Internazionale Milano and Liverpool FC at Stadio San Siro on December 09, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

According to the report, Inter and other unnamed Serie A clubs are tracking Bassey‚Äôs situation, but Fulham are unwilling to sell their defender this month.

MANCHESTER, ENGLAND ‚Äì MARCH 02: Calvin Bassey of Fulham celebrates scoring his team‚Äôs first goal with teammates Timothy Castagne (L) and Adama Traore (R) during the Emirates FA Cup Fifth Round match between Manchester United and Fulham at Old Trafford on March 02, 2025 in Manchester, England. (Photo by Justin Setterfield/Getty Images)

Bassey has scored one goal in 18 appearances across all competitions this season and is a pivotal member of the team, whom Fulham don‚Äôt want to sell midway through the season.

Therefore, any potential move might only happen in the summer, when Inter will still be looking for at least one new centre-back.

Inter face Napoli with Cristian Chivu expected to make a final call on his defence, while Francesco Acerbi remains part of the discussion ahead of a possible exit.

That would confirm Manuel Akanji in the centre of defence and Piotr Zielinski in midfield.

Therefore with Yann Bisseck and Alessandro Bastoni completing the back three.

However, the decision is not yet locked in.

The newspaper reports that Chivu will only make his definitive choice today, or even during the pre-match warm-up on Sunday morning.

Acerbi remains an alternative option, and a reshuffle involving Akanji cannot be ruled out at this stage.

Elsewhere, there are no major doubts.

Inter are expected to stick with continuity across the rest of the lineup.

Therefore prioritising stability for a fixture that could prove decisive in the title race.

There is also positive news from the bench.

Both Andy Diouf and Matteo Darmian are set to return to the matchday squad after recovering their fitness.

Indeed, offering Chivu additional depth.

Get the final details right, trust recent momentum, and deliver a statement performance against Napoli.

title: How to watch Ohio State vs. Washington: TV, live stream info, storylines for Sunday's game
description: The Buckeyes continue their West Coast swing in Seattle.
fullText:
Making a push for its first NCAA Tournament appearance in five years, Ohio State will play Washington on the road Sunday in a Big Ten matchup on Peacock.

The Buckeyes (3-2 Big Ten, 11-4 overall) are on a West Coast road swing that opened Thursday with a 72-62 victory over Oregon. Ohio State, which was picked to finish ninth in a preseason conference media poll, averaged a 25-point margin of victory during a six-game winning streak earlier this season.

The Huskies (1-3 Big Ten, 9-6 overall) are starting a tough three-game homestand against the Midwestern stalwarts of the Big Ten. After Ohio State, Washington will welcome No. 2 Michigan and No. 12 Michigan State next week.

Washington leads 8-5 over Ohio State in the series, including a 6-0 record in Seattle.

More information below on Ohio State and Washington and how to watch the game.

The Buckeyes feature an efficient offense that ranks in the top 25 nationally in field goal percentage (50.6) and is fifth in the Big Ten at 84.6 points per game. Ohio State also makes 78.4% of its free throws (eighth in the country) but struggles from distance, converting only 34.3% of its 3-pointers.

In the win over Oregon, all five starters scored in double figures. Devin Royal and Christoph Tilly each had 14 points, senior leader Bruce Thornton had 12, John Mobley Jr. added 13, and Amare Bynum chipped in with 10. Thornton has 1,787 career points, recently passed Jim Jackson for seventh in program history.

Head coach Jake Diebler is in his third season at Ohio State nad had led the team to a 36-22 record.

The Huskies protect the ball (10.8 turnovers per game is in the top 100 nationally) and shoot well at the line (77.7% on free throws), but field goal shooting is a major weakness. Washington are shooting 51.9% inside the 3-point line, which ranks 229th in the country.

Washington is on a two-game losing streak after falling 81-73 to No. 5 Purdue on the road Wednesday. Star freshman forward Hannes Steinbach (17 points, averaging 18.2 points and 11.2 rebounds per game) led four starters in double-figures as Washington rallied from a 17-point deficit behind Quimari Peterson (15 points), Zoom Diallo (14) and Franck Kepnang (10).

Head coach Danny Sprinkle is in his second season at Washington after winning the Mountain West regular title and an NCAA Tournament game with Utah State in 2023-24.

Where: Alaska Airlines Arena in Seattle, Washington

Northwestern vs. Rutgers, 5 p.m. ET

title: Why Portsmouth FA Cup return gives Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta the shivers ‚Äì plus the latest on Kai Havertz
description: Arsenal return to Fratton Park for an FA Cup tie steeped in recent history, as Mikel Arteta prepares his side for a tricky trip to Portsmouth with memories of one of the most surreal nights of his man...
fullText:
Arsenal return to Fratton Park for an FA Cup tie steeped in recent history, as Mikel Arteta prepares his side for a tricky trip to Portsmouth with memories of one of the most surreal nights of his managerial career still lingering.

The last time Arteta stood in the Portsmouth dugout, in March 2020, football, and the world, was on the brink of shutting down. Arsenal won that evening en route to lifting the FA Cup later that summer, but for their head coach, the memory is a deeply personal one.

‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt feeling great, to be fair,‚Äù Arteta recalled. ‚ÄúThe moment we scored, I was desperate to go home. I was shaking.‚Äù Within days, football would pause entirely as the Covid-19 pandemic took hold, making that night on the south coast an unlikely landmark at the start of an extraordinary period.

Four years on, Arsenal return as a far more established force, but Arteta is keen to stress that past achievements count for little as the current side continues its pursuit of silverware.

‚ÄúWe get judged for what we do today,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúLast week is not important. We‚Äôll be judged for what we‚Äôre able to do at the end of the season.‚Äù

That relentless focus underpins Arsenal‚Äôs approach to this season‚Äôs FA Cup, a competition Arteta famously won in his first year as a manager, albeit in virtually empty Wembley Stadium. The desire to lift trophies in front of supporters remains a powerful motivator.

‚ÄúAnd the big ones as well,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what we are chasing. That‚Äôs the purpose of this team.‚Äù

Team news ahead of the Portsmouth tie offers encouragement, particularly around Kai Havertz, who is closing in on a return for the first time this season. Arteta confirmed the forward has stepped up his training load and is responding well.

‚ÄúIf everything goes well, I think he‚Äôs going to be in the squad again in the next few days,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúHe trains well; he‚Äôs coping with that really well.‚Äù

Arteta was quick, however, to underline the standards awaiting any returning player. ‚ÄúWhen a player has the chance to put our shirt on and compete for us, the demands are excellence and that‚Äôs it.‚Äù

Rotation is likely with a heavy run of fixtures looming, including four away games across competitions in the coming weeks. Arteta acknowledged the need to manage minutes carefully, while still maintaining momentum.

‚ÄúWe have to make sure everybody is participating, we continue to perform and win games,‚Äù he said.

Goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga, who has impressed in the League Cup, is among those pushing for a start, while Riccardo Calafiori is expected to miss out as the tie comes too soon in his recovery. There is also uncertainty around Piero Hincapie‚Äôs fitness after he was forced off against Liverpool on Thursday night, potentially opening the door further for Myles Lewis-Skelly to stake his claim.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs playing and he‚Äôs doing well,‚Äù Arteta said. ‚ÄúHe needs to continue to do that.‚Äù

title: Agent Of Inter Milan Target Says ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Nice‚Äù To Know Big Clubs Are Interested
description: Inter interest in Cagliari goalkeeper Elia Caprile has been publicly acknowledged by the player‚Äôs agent, who admits it is ‚Äúnice‚Äù to know the Nerazzurri are watching closely.According to an inter...
fullText:
Inter interest in Cagliari goalkeeper Elia Caprile has been publicly acknowledged by the player‚Äôs agent, who admits it is ‚Äúnice‚Äù to know the Nerazzurri are watching closely.

According to an interview with RAI Sport, Caprile‚Äôs agent Omar Rahman confirmed that Inter have been tracking the goalkeeper for some time.

‚ÄúInter‚Äôs interest? It‚Äôs nice to know that big clubs are following you,‚Äù Rahman said.

‚ÄúEven when he was at Bari, Inter and Benfica had already made enquiries about Elia.‚Äù

The comments further underline Inter‚Äôs long-standing appreciation of the Verona-born shot-stopper, who has continued to grow since joining Cagliari.

CAGLIARI, ITALY ‚Äì AUGUST 24: Elia Caprile of Cagliari in action during the Serie A match between Cagliari Calcio and ACF Fiorentina at Stadio Sant‚ÄôElia on August 24, 2025 in Cagliari, Italy. (Photo by Enrico Locci/Getty Images)

Caprile has impressed with his consistency and personality, establishing himself as a reliable presence between the posts despite his young age.

Inter‚Äôs interest is not merely theoretical.

As previously reported, the Nerazzurri are actively monitoring Caprile‚Äôs development and have recently sent a scout to observe him live.

The goalkeeper is viewed as a profile aligned with Inter‚Äôs future planning: young, Italian and financially accessible.

While there are no negotiations are currently underway.

However, the continued attention from Viale della Liberazione confirms Caprile‚Äôs status as one of the most closely followed goalkeepers in Serie A.

For now, Caprile remains focused on Cagliari, but the interest from Inter is firmly on record.

title: Toyota‚Äôs 2026 WEC objectives: Fix operational errors and win Le Mans again
description: Toyota has high expectations from the TR010 Hybrid as it enters the 2026 WEC
fullText:
Toyota has outlined its objectives for the 2026 World Endurance Championship, stating it wants to end its Le Mans 24 Hours victory drought and reduce operational errors.

Once the benchmark in the WEC‚Äôs top division, Toyota went the first seven rounds of the 2025 season without scoring a race win, before finally breaking through in the season finale in Bahrain.

It is now three years since the marque last won Le Mans and two since it claimed the drivers‚Äô title, while 2025 marked the first time it didn‚Äôt win the manufacturers‚Äô title in the Hypercar era.

But the Japanese manufacturer is aware of its shortcomings and has developed a heavily revised version of its Le Mans Hypercar, which was officially launched earlier this week under the TR010 Hybrid name.

It is the third major evolution of the car that originally debuted as the GR010 Hybrid in 2021, with a particular focus made on aerodynamics to maximise its speed under the Balance of Performance framework.

Toyota Racing vice-president Kazuki Nakajima admitted that the brand has been frustrated by its results at La Sarthe in recent years, but is confident the TR010 Hybrid can help reverse that trend.

‚ÄúThe biggest objective is clearly to win Le Mans,‚Äù Nakajima told Motorsport.com. ‚ÄúAfter three years of frustrating results in Le Mans, this is clearly the biggest target, as well as winning the championship, because we always look for these two big targets.

‚ÄúBut if I have to rate between two, I think Le Mans comes first priority.‚Äù

Toyota was long regarded as the strongest operational outfit in the WEC, often winning races through superior execution ‚Äì even as competition intensified in the Hypercar era.

But the Cologne-based team‚Äôs usual clinical approach faltered on several occasions in 2025, as it tried to overcome what it felt was an unfavourable BoP at times.

The Lone Star Le Mans round proved particularly costly, with Toyota making a series of errors, including an ill-timed call to fit slick tyres on the #7 GR010 Hybrid while the track was still damp late in the race.

Nakajima admitted that the team hasn‚Äôt been on top of its game this year and has made addressing this weakness a priority for 2025.

‚ÄúThe team's execution like strategy, pit stop, drivers‚Äô performance, not making mistakes and things like that, these are a big part of the performance factor in the race,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe just need to focus on this part.

Toyota reveals new-look WEC Hypercar for 2026 amid wider revamp

WEC Hypercar and IMSA GTP: Who is introducing updates in 2026 and who isn't?

‚ÄúWe have to admit that we have not been at the level that we are aiming for in terms of team execution this year [2025].

‚ÄúIn some races, we really performed well as a team but in some [other] races, we made mistakes. So, as a team we still need to improve ourselves, and this is a clear target for next year.‚Äù

To read more Motorsport.com articles visit our website.

title: Broncos focusing on the details preparing for Divisional Round playoff matchup
description: The Denver Broncos are focusing on the details and hoping last year‚Äôs playoff experience will have them better prepared this time around.
fullText:
We will know in just a few days who the Denver Broncos wind up playing in the 2026 NFL Playoff Divisional Round. Their 2025 regular season was a banner campaign. By notching fourteen wins, the Broncos are back to the top of the AFC West. Even better? They have the perks of a first-round playoff bye after securing the number one seed.

It wasn‚Äôt always pretty, but Denver showed a lot of toughness and tenacity this season. Embarking on multiple comeback wins, their penchant for fourth quarter comebacks coupled with a stellar defense propelled them to the best regular season record in the AFC in ‚Äò25.

That‚Äôs something to be proud of. But now, everyone that made the postseason has a clean slate and an opportunity to etch their names into the NFL record books by winning Super Bowl 60. Everyone is back to square one.

In order for the Broncos to secure their fourth Lombardi Trophy, they will certainly need to work on the finer details. Over the course of the season, the Broncos struggled to be consistent‚Äîespecially on the offensive side of the ball. Fixing that will be crucial in order for the Broncos to make a deep postseason push. Veteran right tackle Mike McGlinchey was vocal on what the team needed to address offensively to take care of business next weekend.

‚ÄúFirst and foremost, the obvious thing is executing in the red zone. You have to turn field goals into touchdowns. That‚Äôs how you win games, especially this late in the year and especially as you go through the playoffs,‚Äù stated McGlinchey.

In addition to red zone performance, being better on a down-to-down basis was next up his list of things to address over the next week. I think all us fans can all agree slow starts were an issue for the Broncos this season. Their erratic and inconsistent performance across the board was one of the most frustrating aspects of an otherwise impeccable season.

‚ÄúWe have to be better on third down by being better on first and second down. It‚Äôs kind of a whole, as you go through these things, there are the ups and downs of the season. You just got to clean up the details, and we‚Äôll be fine.‚Äù

üîô to work.

üëÄ on the Divisional Round. pic.twitter.com/eN6SNec3lV

‚Äî Denver Broncos (@Broncos) January 9, 2026

One primary factor that has contributed to their lack of consistency has been penalties. Denver had plenty of during the regular season. On top of that, the Broncos were one of the teams that ranked highest in drops. It‚Äôs hard enough beating another team each and every weekend, but even more arduous by shooting yourself in the foot. By fixing those things, they should be able to hit their stride like McGlinchey is hoping for. If so, I‚Äôd be very optimistic about their chances next weekend‚Äîwhoever they end up facing.

But it isn‚Äôt just cleaning up the finer details that the Broncos are working on. They‚Äôre also trying to learn from last year‚Äôs playoff experience as a tool to help put themselves in a better position this time around. Very few players on the roster last year had ever experienced the bright lights of the postseason.

With virtually most of their roster experiencing last season, Denver is certainly more experienced in 2026 and far more battle-tested to know what‚Äôs at stake next weekend. And the players know having a hometown crowd cheering them on will certainly be an advantage.

‚ÄúThat it‚Äôs a tournament for a reason. It‚Äôs do or die. I think last year, it was our first taste of it going into the playoffs as a Wild Card team, but now we have home-field advantage, which is different,‚Äù stated shutdown cornerback Patrick Surtain II.

Maybe I‚Äôm just bullish on Denver, but this year‚Äôs team just feels different. Better prepared, far more diligent, and a knack for gutting out close victories. That is something they hadn‚Äôt done in a very long time. They also seemed to play with a chip on their shoulder after all the preseason shade that was thrown their way.

The power of belief is a strong thing. For the most part, the Broncos had the right mindset and approach versus their opponents on a week-to-week basis. By harnessing this past years‚Äô experience coupled with learning from last year‚Äôs early Wild Card Round exit, Denver should be better poised to weather whatever storm heads to Empower Field at Mile High next weekend.

‚ÄúWe have to definitely prep the right way and not take this thing for granted. Earlier on we talked about it, this is probably the last time that this whole team is going to be together, knowing how the league works. I feel like for this moment here, for all the marbles and stuff like that, we all have to buy in and understand that,‚Äù added Surtain.

title: Who will play in the 2026 Super Bowl? Here's what logo theory predicts
description: The Super Bowl is a month away, and everyone wants to know which two teams will play. Some say the Super Bowl logo predicts it. Here's what to know.
fullText:
As the 2026 Super Bowl creeps closer and closer, fans have started to make their predictions as to which two teams will play in the big game.

The Seattle Seahawks are the NFC's No. 1 seed, while the Denver Broncos are the AFC's No.1 seed. Yet there's a lot more to winning than just rankings; it takes team chemistry, skill and just the perfect amount of luck to make it to the Super Bowl.

However, some fans believe that none of that matters because the two teams playing in the big game can be predicted by the year's Super Bowl logo.

Here's the story behind the theory and what teams might be on the way to the Super Bowl.

The theory is that the colors included in that year's Super Bowl logo are the colors of the two teams that will play in the Super Bowl that year.

The theory came to be after fans started to notice that teams that made it to the big game had their colors incorporated into the big game logo for that year. The NFL Super Bowl logo is released a year before the big game, so there's no way anyone could accurately predict which teams would be playing each year.

So this isn't just an arbitrary theory, there is some evidence to it ... or coincidences, believers say.

For Super Bowl LVI in 2022, the logo featured red, orange and yellow tones. The two teams to play that year were the Los Angeles Rams, sporting blue and yellow uniforms, and the Cincinnati Bengals, wearing orange and black.

The logo for Super Bowl LVII in 2023, which was played in Glendale, shows a red-rock desert background with pink, teal and orangey-red colors. The two teams that played that year were the red Kansas City Chiefs and green Philadelphia Eagles, which are similar enough to the logo colors for the theory to continue.

However, the Super Bowl LVIII logo in 2024 featured a purple and pinkish-red color, which did not predict the showdown between the Chiefs and the 49ers, as both teams' colors are red and do not incorporate any purple. True believers of the conspiracy theory think this happened because the purple Baltimore Ravens had to be eliminated to make way for Travis Kelce's Chiefs and his pop-star girlfriend, Taylor Swift, to draw more fans to the big game.

The Super Bowl LIX¬†logo in 2025 was green and red coloring to it, and once again, the Chiefs and Eagles played in the Super Bowl, keeping the theory alive.

üö®JUST IN: NBC HAS JUST ANNOUNCED THE OFFICIAL 2025 SUPER BOWL LOGO.

üëÄüëÄüëÄ 

Wow‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/Lr9JBjGURl

‚Äî MLFootball (@MLFootball) February 10, 2025

The logo for Super Bowl LX was revealed in February 2025 and features a multitude of bright colors, making it difficult to narrow down which team it could represent.

Pink and blue are the main colors featured in this year's brightly colored logo; however, since no teams have pink in their jerseys, the main colors to look for are blue, green, and yellow.

To narrow down what this could mean for the logo theory, here are some teams that incorporate those colors into their uniforms.

Out of that list, the teams that are currently still in the playoffs are: Denver Broncos, New England Patriots, Los Angeles Chargers, Jacksonville Jaguars,¬†Buffalo Bills, Pittsburgh Steelers,¬†Houston Texans, Seattle Seahawks, Chicago Bears, Green Bay Packers, Philadelphia Eagles, San Francisco 49ers, Carolina Panthers and¬†Los Angeles Rams.

With all the differing colors and teams these colors could represent, there are many theories as to what this logo could mean.

The discord between logo theorists will continue until it's really revealed which two teams will play in the big game.

The Super Bowl LX is on Sunday, February 8, 2026, at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California.

This article originally appeared on Arizona Republic: Who will play in the 2026 Super Bowl? What logo theory predicts

title: Notts County sign forward Enoru from Tamworth
description: Notts County sign forward Beck-Ray Enoru from National League side Tamworth for an undisclosed fee.
fullText:
Notts County have signed forward Beck-Ray Enoru from National League side Tamworth on a two-and-a-half-year deal for an undisclosed fee.

The 23-year-old helped the Lambs to promotion from National League North in 2024 after joining the Staffordshire club from Leicestershire non-league side Barwell.

Enoru, who arrived in England from Cameroon at the age of 16, now steps up to League Two with the "blessings" of those at Tamworth despite the Lambs being "disappointed" to lose a player that has been "a big part of the club's success".

Lambs boss Andy Peaks said offers came in during the summer and that Enoru has "decided now is the right time" to move.

Magpies director of football Richard Montague told the club website that Enoru has a "very exciting profile" and will "add another dimension" to Notts' attack.

Find all the latest football transfers on our dedicated page

title: Pat Surtain says Broncos feel 'very dangerous' going into NFL playoffs
description: "I feel like we are very dangerous knowing that we have home-field advantage right in front of us," Pat Surtain said going into the NFL playoffs.
fullText:
The Denver Broncos secured the No. 1 seed in the AFC playoffs after going 14-3 in the regular season. They now enter the NFL playoffs, and there's no room for error in the win-or-go-home format.

Last year, the Broncos made the playoffs for the first time since 2015, but they were promptly eliminated in the wild-card round. Now back in the postseason, they're looking to make a deep run with home-field advantage.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just a mindset, I believe," cornerback Pat Surtain said when asked what changes for a player in the playoffs. "We all realize in a tournament it‚Äôs do or die. It‚Äôs really almost zero margin of error once you‚Äôre in the tournament. We feel like, as a team we have a lot to correct and a lot to adjust, but at the end of the day, we are glad we have home-field advantage. You need as much of an advantage going into the playoffs. That‚Äôs a huge part of it, securing the No. 1 seed and getting home-field advantage. That‚Äôs big time for us. I feel like we aren‚Äôt a finished product. We aren‚Äôt where we want to be yet. Like I said before, I feel like we are very dangerous knowing that we have home-field advantage right in front of us.‚Äù

After a first-round bye, Denver will host the lowest advancing seed from the AFC in the divisional round next week. The Broncos will face either the Los Angeles Chargers (No. 7), Buffalo Bills (No. 6), Houston Texans (No. 5) or Pittsburgh Steelers (No. 4) on either Jan. 17 or Jan. 18. Denver will know its opponent and schedule by Monday evening.

Social: Follow¬†Broncos Wire¬†on¬†Facebook¬†and¬†Twitter/X!¬†Did you know:¬†These 25 celebrities are Broncos fans.

This article originally appeared on Broncos Wire: NFL: Broncos feel 'very dangerous' going into NFL playoffs

title: Chiefs legend Dustin Colquitt named to Missouri Sports Hall of Fame
description: Kansas City Chiefs legend Dustin Colquitt named to the Missouri Sports Hall of Fame | @EdEastonJr
fullText:
The Kansas City Chiefs' legends continue to receive their praise well after their playing days have ended. The latest retired Chiefs star to be honored is long-time punter Dustin Colquitt, who was recently named to the Missouri Sports Hall of Fame class of 2026.

Colquitt, who will be enshrined on February 1st in Springfield, played the most games in franchise history and was a two-time Pro Bowler for Kansas City. He was a member of the Kansas City Super Bowl LIV championship team and recently officially retired with the franchise.

The former Tennessee Volunteer was selected by the Chiefs in the third round of the 2005 NFL Draft after his illustrious collegiate career. He spent 14 seasons in Kansas City before joining various teams in the final stretch of his career.

For 15 seasons, Colquitt experienced the franchise's highs and lows. In 238 regular-season games with the Chiefs, Colquitt tallied 1,167 punts and an impressive 477 inside the 20.

This article originally appeared on Chiefs Wire: Chiefs legend Dustin Colquitt named to Missouri Sports Hall of Fame

title: Stephen Ross' legacy in balance with Miami Dolphins' next hire | Habib
description: Stephen Ross has a new GM (Jon-Eric Sullivan). If he can land John Harbaugh, it will redefine his ownership of the Miami Dolphins.
fullText:
Fourth-and-goal, 8-yard line, five seconds left in the Super Bowl, down by four. If that‚Äôs enough to make your palms sweaty, good.

If it‚Äôs enough to make Stephen Ross‚Äô palms sweaty, even better.

Aaron Brewer is about to snap the ball to you, Steve. What you do with it will cement your legacy, that‚Äôs all. You‚Äôre not just cleaning house for the Miami Dolphins, but rebuilding it from the ground up. Get it right and much of the past 17 years becomes a footnote. Maybe not forgotten, but forgiven. They say this is a ‚Äúwhat have you done for me lately?‚Äù world, so all you have to do is nail these hirings the way you have so often done in the business world.

Jon-Eric Sullivan is the new general manager. Within days, John Harbaugh will be the new head coach, at least if the collective will of South Florida has anything to say about it. Together they‚Äôll represent a sweeping change the likes of which this franchise hasn‚Äôt undertaken in forever.

More Dolphins: New GM pledges Dolphins will be physical, tough and resilient. | Schad

If their results also produce sweeping change ‚Äî if the Dolphins become relevant again this time of year ‚Äî it will rewrite the book on Ross‚Äô ownership of the Dolphins, which started in 2009. All those years of mediocrity. Of missing the playoffs. Of seeing coaches such as Joe Philbin come and Dan Campbell go. Of failing with the wrong quarterbacks and flailing at the right ones. Roll it into a ball and give Ross a pass if on fourth-and-goal, he seals the deal.

Ross said after last season that status quo was a no-go. He followed by firing general manager Chris Grier on Halloween and coach Mike McDaniel two days after the season. That‚Äôs how things go in the cutthroat world that is the NFL, although doubt creeps into one‚Äôs mind wondering if those fans celebrating their departures would do so if they actually knew either man. (Illegal use of sentiment, I know.)

We‚Äôre just getting to know Sullivan, who will be leaving his role as vice president of player personnel in Green Bay. He has spent 22 years in the Packers‚Äô organization, so we know he‚Äôs loyal, experienced in making shrewd decisions and about to ditch his ice scraper. He learned from some of the best, including Ted Thompson and Brian Gutekunst. And he learned where his strengths lie.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôve got to know who you are,‚Äù he said in a YouTube video on ‚ÄúThe Unsung‚Äù while explaining why he‚Äôs not a coach. ‚ÄúI think I‚Äôm a better evaluator than I am a patient teacher.‚Äù

Trust your eyes more than your numbers. ‚ÄúAnalytics are not going to supersede the film,‚Äù he said.

Don‚Äôt rely on other teams‚Äô rejects. ‚ÄúYou build through the draft,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a young man‚Äôs game. You want to make sure you‚Äôre acquiring young, talented players that fit your culture. I think you experiment through free agency. ‚Ä¶ Those are dangerous waters to tread in all the time because teams typically aren‚Äôt moving from good players that are healthy and good in the locker room.‚Äù

Collaboration (that often-overused word inside the Dolphins‚Äô facility) has its limits. ‚ÄúIf we are all agreeing, nobody is thinking, you know what I mean?‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIf I‚Äôm a decision-maker and have a bunch of guys in the room tell me what I want to hear, that‚Äôs not very valuable to me.‚Äù

Whereas earning a wild-card spot has been cause for celebration in Miami, it‚Äôs nothing new to Sullivan. The Packers won the Super Bowl in 2010, a year after Ross took over the Dolphins. Green Bay qualified for this year‚Äôs playoffs, as it has all of the past seven seasons except one. That leaves Dolphins fans in a bind, knowing Sullivan‚Äôs hire looks smarter with each successive Packers victory, but each victory postpones when Sullivan can toss half his wardrobe and start fixing the Dolphins.

One more thing. Might as well address the elephant in the room: What‚Äôs with the hyphenated name?

‚ÄúI‚Äôm still wondering about that,‚Äù Sullivan said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure why my parents did that to me. ‚Ä¶ At this point nobody calls me Jon. But nobody calls me Jon-Eric, either. It‚Äôs either J.E. or Sully, which I‚Äôm OK with, because Jon-Eric‚Äôs a lot to spit out. I don‚Äôt like introducing myself as Jon-Eric because I see people tilt their head and wonder, ‚ÄòIs this your first and middle name? Is this your whole first or last name?‚Äô ‚Äù

That brings us to J.W. Harbaugh, better known as John.

No sense putting too much on reports that the Dolphins haven‚Äôt yet contacted him. Word is Harbaugh won‚Äôt begin sorting out his next chapter until next week. And so much of this business can be a matter of semantics. If Ross called an end-around and his people contacted Harbaugh‚Äôs people using the Cone of Silence buried inside a back channel, does that constitute ‚Äúcontact‚Äù? And while it would be nice for Harbaugh to know he‚Äôs very much wanted here, is there even the slightest chance, given Ross‚Äô longstanding ties to the Harbaugh family, that a man as sharp as John doesn‚Äôt already know that?

The real pickle is what happens if Harbaugh‚Äôs next stop is elsewhere, say a team with a stable quarterback situation or a salary cap that isn‚Äôt drowning in red ink. Would Ross have fired McDaniel anyway? Would that bring, say, Jacksonville defensive coordinator Anthony Campanile back into the picture? Or has Ross had enough of first-time head coaches and does he go with Mike McCarthy?

We just witnessed quarterback Carson Beck carry the Miami Hurricanes into the end zone in a scenario not unlike the fourth-and-goal test Ross now faces.

There can be no question Ross will happily meet Harbaugh‚Äôs price.

Does he get to write the check, and with it, a new narrative on his ownership of the Dolphins?

This article originally appeared on Palm Beach Post: Dolphins' Stephen Ross hits legacy-defining moment on John Harbaugh

title: Colorado adds two intriguing lineman as transfer portal class grows
description: Colorado added a Sacramento State offensive lineman and a San Jose State defensive lineman, pushing the Buffs‚Äô transfer portal class to 25 players.
fullText:
Colorado football added two linemen to its now 25-player deep transfer portal class. Former Sacramento State offensive lineman Jose Soto and San Jose State defensive lineman Vili Taufatofua have both committed to the Buffaloes.

Soto reunites with his former head coach, Colorado's new offensive coordinator, Brennan Marion. The 6-foot-3, 312-pounder was the Hornets' starting right guard in 2025. He did not allow a sack or quarterback hit in conference play. Soto provides depth along CU's offensive line as the Buffs' third offensive line transfer addition.

Taufatofua becomes Colorado's eighth commit on the defensive line. He is coming off an All-Mountain West Honorable Mention season where he racked up 34 tackles, seven tackles for loss, three sacks, two forced fumbles and one pass breakup. He started in 11 games last season.

The New Zealand native began his FBS career at Utah but did not see any action. He is the seventh projected edge rusher that the Buffs added, signalling a clear plan to improve the defensive line and, more specifically, the pass rush.

Let‚Äôs Work! Go Buffs ü¶¨#Commited pic.twitter.com/eaf6AfpZ0T

‚Äî Vili Taufatofua (@ViliTaufatofua) January 10, 2026

Taufatofua and Soto continue the trend of Colorado adding highly productive lower-level players. The strategy is sound, especially after a 3-9 season, and one Sanders believes in.
